definition: to toss/to throw dice/Taiwan pr. [zhi2]
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
to throw sth a long distance/to hurl/to throw at/to throw (dice etc)/to flip (a coin)
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
to stake all on one throw
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
to throw/to cast
to throw the dice
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
please return (an item sent in the mail)
poe divination, a traditional Chinese divination method where a pair of crescent-shaped wooden or bamboo blocks is thrown on the ground, with the positions of the blocks determining the divine answer
to throw the dice

sentences.english: He dashed the cup down in his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他生氣了，使勁把杯子擲下。

sentences.english: A whole valley of boulders tossed higgledy-piggledy as though by some giant .
sentences.chinese: 整個山谷裏巨石翻滾，就像有巨人在狂扔亂擲。

sentences.english: Whenever you reroll, you must abide by the result of the second roll.
sentences.chinese: 每當你重擲時，你都必須接受第二次擲骰的結果。

sentences.english: They can throw the medicine ball very far.
sentences.chinese: 他們能把健身實心球擲得很遠。

sentences.english: And flung my eager craft through footless halls of air.
sentences.chinese: 將我的渴望擲向那無邊的空中。

sentences.english: I saw some roughness throwing stones to any dog.
sentences.chinese: 我看見幾個男孩在擲石頭打狗。

sentences.english: Let's toss up a penny for the chance to go first.
sentences.chinese: 我們擲一枚一便士的硬幣來決定誰先去。

sentences.english: You can throw the ball farther if you bring the ball behind the head while throwing.
sentences.chinese: 如果你吧把球置於腦後再擲，你能把球擲得更遠一些。

sentences.english: You can throw the ball farther if you bring the ball behind the head while throwing.
sentences.chinese: 如果你吧把球置於腦後再擲，你能把球擲得更遠一些。

sentences.english: Now I step back behind the three-point line and throw up a long rainbow.
sentences.chinese: 然後我退後一步踏出三分線外，擲出一道長長的彩虹。

sentences.english: Flip a coin that many times or until you lose a flip, whichever comes first.
sentences.chinese: 擲同樣次數的硬幣，或是直到你輸去任何一擲爲止。

sentences.english: At last they hurled huge stones at enemy's heads.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他們用大石頭向敵人的頭上用力擲了過去。

sentences.english: The angler her line into the stream.
sentences.chinese: 那個垂釣者把魚線擲進了小溪裏。

sentences.english: We have not worked on the long throws from the right-hand side so that was a bonus.
sentences.chinese: 我們沒有在右路擲界外球，所以這是對我們的獎勵。

sentences.english: A higher roll led to more tickets.
sentences.chinese: 骰子擲出的點數越高，彩券得的就越多。
